title: Helvetica font not displaying properly with greek language, in various applications, including Firefox and Thunderbird
content:
Hi everyone! 

  I come back for a problem that I faced some months ago and I think is getting worse, meaning that it looks like it is affecting more applications.    I first noticed that there are some greek websites, that are loading pop-up cookies settings with corrupted greek characters. The rest of the site displays greek properly. When I open the Inspector and check the font, it is Helvetica family font that is not appearing correctly (image 1). This is the case when in Settings->General->Fonts->Advanced, the "Allow pages to choose their own fonts, instead of your selections above" checkbox is selected-ticked. When the checkbox is de-selected/unticked, the same pop-up cookies settings is displaying properly (image 2). The problem remains using Chrome, but Firefox is my main browser.    The same issue exists with Thunderbird as well, where again in Settings->General->Fonts->Advanced, the checkbox "Allow messages to use other fonts" changes the way emails appear in greek language (images 3 and 4).    I have also noticed that with Discord application, there is a similar issue (image 5). Some greek characters are not displaying properly. I uninstalled and reinstalled Discord (in greek), but the problem remains the same. When installing english version of Discord, it is ok.   The problem also seems to be with greek language versions of websites, like facebook homepage in english and in greek language (images 6 and 7).   I have tried to search for similar problems and suggested solutions on the internet, but there is no permanent solution so far for my PC. I have followed https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-extensions-themes-to-fi... solution, running Firefox in Troubleshoot mode, which resolves the problem temporarily, but not permanently. According to the above solution, "the likely cause is an extension, theme or hardware acceleration", but when I follow every step to determine which one of these (extension, theme or hardware acceleration) is the problem, all of these prove to work properly (supposing I'm following steps correctly).   I'm not sure if this is a Mozilla or a Windows issue. Therefore, any suggestions for a permanent solution would be much appreciated.
creator: iliastolos

title: Regaining original sync info
content: Hi Support. Lately I had to use a temporary laptop (Laptop B), while waiting for a new battery for my original laptop (Laptop A). I had to ask for a new password and learned that I had lost my saved info on the sync server. When I'll be able to go back to laptop A, I will get access back to the passwords and other info that are already there in the browser, but I fear that I could lost them on a resyncing process. Could you tell me what would be the process to load my information from laptop A Firefox browser on the Mozilla server via Sync, (regaining my original info) and override the little info that was sync from laptop B ? Thanks

title: Extreme FF/Windows Explorer GUI instability playing hardware accelerated video
content:
This started happening to FF a few weeks ago, it has stopped with hardware accel disabled, but I would prefer it turned back on. Only happens during video playback on any website, and obviously youtube

http://paullinebarger.net/files/20221019_001628.mp4 (Oddly enough my FF will not play the video on that, but will the audio)

Is MP4 messed up? I disabled VP9 in config because I wasn't sure if youtube was using it for lower resolutions

Sometimes when you put it the windowed it stops. Sometimes it does not if the window is a certain size

I've never seen FF do any thing remotely like this. My 10th gen Intel (hers is a 10th intel as well) has never done this. In fact I put most of my customers on FF and have not had reports of such things from any of them

When this first started, after FF was closed the TTF fonts on the screen would act strange, like the vector resolution would dip and go back up. Very strange so I rebooted and it fixed that. I updated firefox, updated intel drivers to newest version manually.

This is one of the strangest things Ive seen

(yes I posted this before with a less than descriptive title and I think it needed a better one) also with details on the same thread start

Please help me. In my 15 years of firefox (and seamonkey) and a few years of netscape i have never encountered such thing
creator: uranium23567

title: New old Bug in 106 With Tabs Space Usage
content:
Hi!

I hardly use tabs, and I have a widescreen notebook. So one of the most important features a browser must have is not to waste vertical space.

Unfortunately, Firefefox still has always tab bar open even if there is only one tab.

There was a css code to overcome this problem. Unfortunately, it does not work with FF 106 anymore (another one stopped working with 103). It always shows a "+" sign and uses vertical space.

1. ) How can I get rid of the tab bar? Is there a working css code or is it a feature now of FF? 2.) BTW, also one of the most important addons for me "I don't care about cookies" is not working anymore 3.) How can I fully stop updates? They are causing far too many problems 4.) I already know that css and addons are not officially supported by Mozilla.

Dimi

title: Since updating from Win10 to Win11 previously open tabs do not open on startup when closing using the X in the top right corner of the browser window
content:
Since updating from Win10 to Win11 previously open tabs do not open on startup when closing using the X in the top right corner of the browser window. I have seen in other posts that if you close FF by using the menu and clicking Exit, the previously open tabs will be opened upon startup. This is indeed true. The users of my computer are however used to using the X in the top right corner to close an application.

Closing with X -> Previously open Tabs do not open on startup. Closing with Menu-Exit -> Previously open Tabs open on startup.

Is it a bug or a feature that the way you close FF decides if the previously open tabs open on startup?


Firefox version: 106.0.1 (64-bit) In the sessionstore-backups folder there are three files: previous.jsonlz4 recovery.baklz4 recovery.jsonlz4
creator: Surf999

content:

59.9.0 (32 bit) running on Vista Home premuim; yes I know it's old.

title: How to have a shortcut to change specific parameter in the configurations?
content:
I want to be able to quickly toggle between No Proxy and using Use system proxy settings which the recommended proxy switcher extension (FoxyProxy Standard) does not support (as it says, due to Firefox limitations).

I see that changing it manually from the network settings will affect the network.proxy.type available in the configuration editor (about:config), and it can be changed from there by assigning values 0 or 5 for my purpose.

How can I toggle it faster? Is it possible with:

  • A specialized URI like about:config which I should bookmark?
  • Defining a keyboard shortcut?
  • Adding a customized button on the toolbar?

Any suggestions?
creator: pedramsh

I downloaded a new version, 106.0.1, but that dmg file wouldn't open: "no such file or directory" (despite ostensibly containing 135 MB). Yet that version seems to be what's running now. I don't know how recently my Firefox got updated; possibly an update is the problem, but why newly today is unclear. I'm now using Safari, since Firefox is kaput.
